com.epoch.session

Class UserSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.session.UserSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnySessionConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StudentSession

    public class UserSession
extends Object
implements AnySessionConstants
    A user's work session. Superclass for instructor, student, admin, and anon sessions.

    • Method Detail

      • debugPrint

        protected static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • setProfile

        public void setProfile(User newValues)
                throws DBException,
                       UniquenessException,
                       StudentNumConstraintException,
                       StudentEmailExistsException
        Modify this user's information.
        Parameters:
        newValues - contains new information about this user
        Throws:
        UniquenessException - when more than one user has this user's login ID
        StudentNumConstraintException - when another user at the same school as this user already has that ID number
        StudentEmailExistsException - when another student at the same school as this user already has that email
        DBException - if the database can't be written to

      • sendTextMessagesToIds

        public static void sendTextMessagesToIds(String[] userIds,
                                         String msg)
                                  throws DBException
        Sends the text message to the listed email addresses of the users with the given IDs.
        Parameters:
        userIds - login IDs of users to whom to send messages so they appear as text messages on the users' phones
        msg - the message
        Throws:
        DBException - if the users with the given IDs cannot be read from the database

      • sendTextMessageNow

        private static void sendTextMessageNow(String email,
                                       String msg)
        Sends the text message to the email address.
        Parameters:
        email - email address to which to send message so it appears as a text message on the user's phone
        msg - the message, modified to escape ' characters

      • sendTextMessage
